availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
R-150-DK-Vol 2/65
Ky State of
Frankfort. Ky. Sept. 12"/65
Bramlett. T. E.
Gov.

Forwards the letter of the Police Judge of Harrodsburg. with copy of a warrent for the arrest of one J. D. Hale. who drew a pistol on a citizen, and was shielded from arrest by one Lt. Bishop. States that Hale is a desperado and should be arrested.

Wrapper
Hd. Qrs 1st Div D. K.
Lexington Ky. Sept 22d 65
B: 451. 1st Dist D K.

Respectfully refered to, A. H. Bowen Maj and, A. Q. G. 1st Div D. K. who will immediately proceed to Harrodsburg, Ky. and investigate the cause of within complaint, and report action to these Hd. Qrs. This paper to be returned --

By Command of Brig Genl Brisbin
S. P. Plummer
Capt and A A A G.
Office Inspt Genl 1st D D Ky
Lexington Ky Sept. 25 1865
Respectfully returned inviting attention to accompanying report

A H Bowen
Maj and A. A. Q. G.
